N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 113.16 - Service of appeal papers, applications and amicus curiae papers

State Regulations
(a) Statement
of appeal. A copy of the statement of appeal and all papers annexed
thereto and any memorandum in connection therewith shall be served upon the
respondent by certified mail (return receipt requested) or by personal service
during normal business hours. (b) Subsequent appeal papers and
applications. Each party to an appeal shall serve upon the other parties
or if any party is represented by counsel, upon his counsel, all subsequent
appeal papers and any papers annexed thereto and any applications or other
papers by certified mail (return receipt requested) or by personal service
during normal business hours. (c) Amicus curiae applications and
papers. An organization or other person applying to the appeal
board for permission to participate in an appeal amicus curiae shall serve his
application on all parties to the appeal or if any party is represented by
counsel, upon his counsel. Any affidavits, memoranda or other papers filed in
an appeal by an amicus curiae shall be served on all parties or if any party is
represented by counsel, upon his counsel. (d) Personal service. Appeal papers may be served personally by any person not a
party to the appeal who is over the age of 18 years. (e) Affidavit of service. Promptly after the service of any appeal paper, the
original, together with an affidavit of service of a copy thereof, shall be
filed with the city board. The affidavit of service shall be in the form set
forth below: STATE OF NEW YORK)..)
